comments.body: @smurching It acutaly got a bit more complicated rather than simplified, but it's inenvitable for now.
@harupy makes sense, I guess ultimately once everything's off travis we can remove this branching logic

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +21,25 @@  # See this repository: https://github.com/actions/virtual-environments
  CONDA_DIR=/usr/share/miniconda
fi

export PATH="$CONDA_DIR/bin:$PATH"

comments.body: Added some conditional logic to only run stuff when `GITHUB_WORKFLOW` is not set.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +3,7 @@set -ex
sudo mkdir -p /travis-install
if [[ -z $GITHUB_WORKFLOW ]]; then
  sudo chown travis /travis-install
fi

comments.body: Github Actions isn't as good about large output, so made some of these things a bit quieter.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +27,31 @@# Install Python test dependencies only if we're running Python tests
if [[ "$INSTALL_SMALL_PYTHON_DEPS" == "true" ]]; then
  pip install --quiet -r ./travis/small-requirements.txt
fi
if [[ "$INSTALL_LARGE_PYTHON_DEPS" == "true" ]]; then

comments.body: Wanted to use `$HOME`, requires avoiding '`' syntax.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +34,38 @@  # Conda installs 2 version spark-* scripts and makes the ones spark
  # uses not executable. This is a temporary fix to unblock the tests.
  ls -lha $(find $HOME/miniconda/envs/test-environment/ -path "*bin/spark-*")
  chmod 777 $(find $HOME/miniconda/envs/test-environment/ -path "*bin/spark-*")
  ls -lha $(find $HOME/miniconda/envs/test-environment/ -path "*bin/spark-*")

comments.body: Copied from the old .travis.yml `install` section ([see comment](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/1097/files#r273299584)) with small changes to how we conditionally install Python dependencies (we now check `INSTALL_SMALL_PYTHON_DEPS` etc below)
